Package  Class  Use  Tree  Deprecated  Index  Help 
SmartSockets Java API
6.8
 PREV PACKAGE   NEXT PACKAGE FRAMES    NO FRAMES    

Package com.smartsockets

Interface Summary
Link hides the details of the network link.
TipcConnClient Handles client end of peer-to-peer connections.
TipcConnServer Handles the server end of a peer-to-peer connection.
TipcCreateCb The user interface for the RTclient's server create callbacks.
TipcDecryptCb The user interface for connection decrypt callbacks.
TipcDefaultCb The user interface for connection default callbacks.
TipcDefs Constants common to several interfaces.
TipcDestroyCb The user interface for the RTclient's server destroy callbacks.
TipcEncryptCb The user interface for connection encrypt callbacks.
TipcErrorCb The user interface for connection error callbacks.
TipcMsg Provides access to message objects.
TipcMsgDecryptFuncInterface The user interface for message decryption functions.
TipcMsgEncryptFuncInterface The user interface for message encryption functions.
TipcMsgFilter User interface for message filters.
TipcMt Provides access to the message type class.
TipcOptionVerifyCb The user interface for TipcOption's value verification callbacks.
TipcProcessCb The user interface for connection process callbacks.
TipcQueueCb The user interface for connection queue callbacks.
TipcReadCb The user interface for connection read callbacks.
TipcSearcher The user interface for the search function required by TipcConnClient.search and TipcSrv.search.
TipcSrv Provides an interface to RTserver connections.
TipcWriteCb The user interface for connection write callbacks.
 

Class Summary
Credentials Credentials class for security manager.
TipcCache Provides an interface to access the messages cached by the SmartSockets Cache daemon.
TipcCb Holds a reference to a callback entry.
TipcMon This class provides a set of static methods that allow a RTclient to monitor a SmartSockets application.
TipcMonExt This class provides a set of static methods that provide the monitoring extensions for an RTclient.
TipcMsgEnumerator A helper class that implements the java.util.Enumeration interface and returns TipcMsgEnumeratorElement when the TipcMsgEnumerator.nextElement() method is invoked.
TipcMsgEnumeratorElement This is the Object that is returned when TipcMsgEnumerator.nextElement() is invoked.
TipcOption Represents one option setting.
TipcProperties Table of TipcOption objects, which can contain another table as its defaults; this second collection is searched if the TipcOption is not found in the original table.
TipcSvc A static factory class for the TipcMt, TipcMsg, TipcConnClient, TipcConnServer, and TipcSrv interfaces.
TipcUtf8Buffer A holder class for return object from the Tut.convertUcs2ToUtf8Ex method
Tut A collection of static utility methods.
TutXml Represents an XML object that can be sent within a SmartSockets message.
 

Exception Summary
TipcAccessDeniedException Thrown when the RTserver denies access to this process.
TipcAlreadyExistsException Thrown when the object already exists.
TipcAlreadySubscribedException Thrown when subscribing to a subject to which the client has already subscribed.
TipcAssertionException Thrown when a fatal runtime exception occurs and by Tut.affirm(boolean, java.lang.String) when the condition fails.
TipcBadArgumentException Thrown when a bad argument is passed to a method.
TipcException Superclass of all SmartSockets exceptions.
TipcFileNotFoundException Thrown when a file does not exist or is inaccessible.
TipcGmdException Thrown if an attempt to create gmd area is unsuccessful.
TipcInterruptedException Thrown when a thread is interrupted by Thread.interrupt while waiting for a message to arrive.
TipcIOException Thrown when a low-level IOException occurs, such as a socket connection is refused or a socket connection is lost.
TipcMalformedURLException Thrown to indicate an invalid URL.
TipcMsgBadFieldException Thrown when attempting to access a TipcMsg field using the incorrect type.
TipcMsgEomException Thrown when attempting to read past the end of a TipcMsg.
TipcMsgException Thrown when an error occurs parsing a TipcMsg.
TipcMsgNotEncryptedException Thrown when attempting to decrypt a message that is not encrypted.
TipcMsgUnknownFieldException Thrown during an attempt to read a TipcMsg field that is marked as "unknown".
TipcNotFoundException Thrown when the requested object is not found by a method.
TipcNotSubscribedException Thrown when unsubscribing from a subject not currently subscribed to by the client.
TipcProtocolMismatchException Thrown trying to send a message to an incompatible peer or server.
TipcProxyException Thrown when a proxy server returns an error.
TipcReadOnlyException Thrown when the requested object is readonly by a method.
TipcRuntimeException Superclass of all SmartSockets runtime exceptions.
TipcSrvAlreadyConnectedException Thrown when a method requires no connection to the RTserver and a connection already exists.
TipcSrvNotConnectedException Thrown when a method requires a connection to the RTserver and the connection does not exist.
TipcTimeoutException Thrown if a timeout occurs while attempting to establish a connection.
TipcWouldBlockException Thrown if an attempt to send or flush would block and the non-blocking mode is set.
